author: Paul Ziobro
title: In Cutting Time to Market, Toy Companies Try On Fast Fashion
text:
Toy companies are mimicking the moves of fast-fashion retailers as they scramble to produce toys and games tied to the swift rise and fall of trends driven by social media.
Hasbro Inc., Mattel Inc. and other companies are rushing to collapse production times and capitalize on fast-moving trends like slime-making kits, and viral videos that can spawn new games and toys. The goal is to spot ideas and get products in stores in a matter of months instead of the following Christmas.
